name: mcp-tool-primitive
definition: A conversationally-negotiated capability with graduated permissions, hot-reload lifecycle, and cross-dimensional state continuity

conversational_negotiation.purpose: Every tool interaction begins with negotiation (identity, intent, alignment)

graduated_permissions.purpose: Every tool has progressive trust ladder (read-only → read-write → execute → admin)

hot_reload_lifecycle.purpose: Every tool supports evolution without restart
hot_reload_lifecycle.protects_against: Conversation loss during updates, restart-required updates

state_continuity.purpose: Every tool maintains conversation memory (WHO/WHAT/HOW dimensions)

tool_isolation.purpose: Each tool class maintains independent state and permissions
tool_isolation.protects_against: State/permission leakage between tools, security bypass via tool switching

immutability: This primitive is not negotiable. This primitive is not augmented. Capabilities emerge from removing constraints on this primitive, never from adding features to it.
emergence_principle: Tool capabilities emerge from constraint removal, never from direct implementation. If you can implement a feature directly, you are doing it wrong.
